Please go easy on me today. At a minimum, you saw me try with all of my heart, and never waver in my eternal faith in you.

Message 3408 of 4024
A year ago today, our lives changed irrevocably. After months of intense emotional connection, I kissed you and our kids goodbye as you left for
Hong Kong. The same people never returned. The moment you landed, you were bombarded with a stream of hate and vitriol. Our daughter missed
her flight, and somehow, this was all your fault because you got the boys on the plane but not our 31-year-old.
It was as if a long-dormant emotional monster, held inside for the last three decades, was suddenly unleashed. Elsa berated you relentlessly, telling you
over and over what an awful mother you were and how you had ruined her life. It was unbearable, and then you asked me to step in; the abuse was
soul-crushing, and to be honest, you sounded as if you would break. Even as I tried, I could not stem the tide of Elsa, the blame, the hate.
In the following days, you revisited the same spots you frequented when you were pregnant as a teenager, staring at the harbor with the sights and
sounds of Hong Kong in full effect. The vibrant colors of the city, the bustling streets, and the smell of the sea must have triggered a flood of
memories. My heart aches for the emotions you must have felt and the onslaught of painful memories you endured on the heels of the assault.
Then you talked with Lilian, who piled on with stories of me being drunk on a visit before the pandemic. I had embarrassed your family and never
been back to apologize. This was unforgivable, and she let it be known what a coward I was for my absence, not apologizing face-to-face even years
later. I deeply regret this incident and acknowledge that my past actions seriously strained our relationship. For that, I am genuinely sorry.
Our minds, fresh from our own spring of self-created amateur “mushroom therapy” to help ease our own trauma and PTSD scars, were perhaps also
open to triggers we were unaware of. It was the downside of uncontrolled experimentation with neuroplasticity, And we would never be the same. All
the pain, anguish, and deep hurt came out in our next phone call. After all that was happening and a well-deserved reason to blame me, I became the
target.
After the best months of our life as a family and married couple, I was the problem now and had been all along from this point of view. Everything
that had happened and gone wrong since leaving Hong Kong was my fault. Then, after you landed, Max told me that in Hong Kong, you had decided
to divorce me when you all got home. Since then, my life has been rewritten, and others have taken over my marriage and parenting.
The changes have profoundly affected our children in the last year, who left that day as happy and optimistic kids and now see us as lifelong enemies.
My primary concern has always been their well-being, and I am committed to maintaining a healthy relationship with them even as this explodes
around us. I have continued to take steps towards sobriety and reconciliation and worked hard to improve myself as a parent.
Sent:07/01/2024 at 06:36 PM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 07/01/2024 at 07:05 PM)
Subject:6/30 An Anniversary of Sorts
Attachments:Screenshot_2024-07-01_183008.jpg (431 KB)

I am fully committed to cooperating with professionals, including Connor and Jennifer, to ensure the best possible outcomes for them. I hope for a
positive co-parenting relationship with you, and I am dedicated to providing a stable, nurturing environment for Max and Adrian. My goal is to move
forward constructively, focusing on the well-being of our children and the potential for a harmonious family dynamic and will continue.
I have done so much research and pored over books, presentations, and white papers, all of which I am happy to share with you. But please know that
It is very possible that the intense emotional experiences and unresolved past traumas, combined with mushrooms, triggered a mental regression in us.
Psychedelic substances sometimes unlock deep-seated memories, bringing them to the surface in unexpected and overwhelming ways.
The sudden flood of painful memories and unresolved trauma, especially those tied to your formative years in Hong Kong, could have caused an
intense psychological reaction that may have led to a well-deserved sense of anger and overdue blame towards me that had been simmering for years. It
was what we talked about fixing before you left. Understanding this does not excuse any harm I have done, but it might help explain the instant
change.
Our passion burns white-hot on both sides of the coin. There is no in-between with us. We went from being the two most seemingly in love people
the world had ever seen to mortal enemies. So for one moment, just a moment, please, after 30 years together, fighting like cats and dogs and
snuggling toes and making love, consider the fact that perhaps we flew too close to the sun and our wings melted. But let's remember who we were,
acknowledge who we've become, and see if we can forge a new path of understanding. But we don’t have to hate each other.
It's been a long year. May we please consider a change?
Message 3409 of 4024
I asked Adrian how he knew the details of your Bellevue home, including rent, as you implied I told him. I have been very careful not to discuss this.
He indicated that he saw this on your computer screen at the Old Bellevue place, says he saw the rent of 7,767 or something like that.
Given that this information came from you, I trust you will correct the record for anyone you have shared that I gave him this information.

The number is wrong but I have not shared that with anyone. Did I say that in anything you saw?
I wish you would not go to him and question him about our conversations. I don’t know what your intentions are, but it shows him things he says to
me might result in an interrogation for mom. Like the California thing I thought we cleared up.
Let’s don’t blow it out or proportion though. It’s a thing we can work on. Not a big deal.
And today was a win! Neither of us got what we wanted but we did not yell or hang up on each other. We both communicated some outstanding
concerns without loosing it. You also let me apologize for past comments and name calling. To me that’s a start!
If we can keep it up we might make progress! Let’s decide if we can make some more quick decisions that make us both equally unhappy...
Thanks again!!!

Fifth Request: Please see below for what an itinerary is. Kindly provide the requested details for my children while they are overseas in your care.

- Dates and times of departure and arrival.
- Flight numbers, train or bus details, or driving directions.
- Check-in and check-out times for accommodations.

- Names and addresses of hotels or other lodging.
- Reservation confirmation numbers.
- Contact information for accommodations.

- Rental car details, including pick-up and drop-off locations.
- Public transportation information, such as subway maps or bus schedules.
- Transfer services, if applicable.

- A breakdown of planned activities and events.
- Times and locations for tours, meetings, or reservations.
- Free time or optional activities.

- Attractions, landmarks, and sites to visit.
- Opening and closing times, ticket information, and tour details.
- Maps and directions.

- Emergency contacts, including local contacts or consulates.
- Travel agency or tour operator contact information.
- Contacts for guides or local hosts.

Is there a way we can work on communicating better? We could have spent the morning together instead of him playing video games. Frankly, he has
no idea what's happening, so I assume it is not a big deal.
Plus, it can't be a tradition. The 4th of July was the biggest holiday of our year. Our tradition. The boys and I had everything planned, and the beach
camp was prepped early, ready to pamper MOM. It was our family's big day!
I guess I am just super hurt. You take every holiday, every break, everything. Even the things that were solely focused on us just chilling as a happy and
healthy family together and being thankful for each other. I have all the pics!
I feel like I'm dead to the family, and it's not right, especially after your secret 4th last year.

all together at the beach or over bbq, to celebrate us and what we have done. Teaching the boys how to take care of a woman and make her feel

special.

Of course, I also understand today is your "Independence Day" with Kevin, but tbh, he doesn't even know AD apart from the few times you made
them eat together. So, I'd appreciate it if we could continue our Moyer family traditions and let you and Kevin just create your own.
Please let me know.

Sent:07/05/2024 at 10:47 AM

Subject:ToDo List

Message 3455 of 4024
It is always tough to talk to them when you have the kids. I think we saw that yesterday. Ideally, you would suggest some convenient windows to chat
and even note some of your activities that I could ask them about so they know we are on the same "parent team."
It is incredibly awkward for us to talk while they are on vacation and not be able to say, "Tell me about your day" without them feeling like they are
being a spy by saying anything about their vacation or I am spying on them to try and figure out what's up.
If we can't find a good way to keep me current and in the loop with the kids, given all that you have arranged away from me overseas in July, it's going
to be a super long month and really unhealthy. I'll need you to help overcome the barriers put up.
- Nov-Feb: Saw AD about five times a week
- March-June: Saw AD about three times a week
- June-Today: See AD once every two weeks
